lamblin.wordcount

Class WordAccumulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • lamblin.wordcount.WordAccumulator

  • public class WordAccumulator
extends java.lang.Object
    Accumulates counts of each word added and total words added. Also retains a sorted set of words.


    Created by dlamblin on 3/21/15.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WordAccumulator() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Adds words to be counted.
      int getCount(java.lang.String word)
      How many of these words were counted.
      java.util.Set<com.google.common.collect.Multiset.Entry<java.lang.String>> getCounts()
      The unordered entry set of words and their counts.
      int getSize()
      The total number of words added.
      java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.String> getSortedWords()

    • Constructor Detail

      • WordAccumulator

        public WordAccumulator()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String word)
        Adds words to be counted. You cannot add words after calling either getCounts() or getSortedWords().
        Parameters:
        word - the word for which to increment its count

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        The total number of words added.
        Returns:
        the total number of all words

      • getCount

        public int getCount(java.lang.String word)
        How many of these words were counted.
        Parameters:
        word - the word counted
        Returns:
        the number of times it was added

      • getCounts

        public java.util.Set<com.google.common.collect.Multiset.Entry<java.lang.String>> getCounts()
        The unordered entry set of words and their counts. Getting this will terminal the accumulator's thread pool and disable the add(java.lang.String) method.
        Returns:
        a set of words and their counts

      • getSortedWords

        public java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.String> getSortedWords()
        The ordered set of words counted. It does not include their counts. Getting this will terminal the accumulator's thread pool and disable the add(java.lang.String) method.
        Returns:
        a set of the words in natural order
